page.title: 11Home Life: Martin's Day
page.content: When I am on holiday I often take our three dogs for a walk down by the river. Our dogs are gun dogs,Max and Tig are German short head pointers and Skipper is a springer spaniel. Lady's Walk is a colourful path on the west side of the river.I can see the waterhens weaving through the bushes and reeds,the ducklings following their mother up the river,the flies resting on the water and fish rising for flies.The footpath takes me through a small wood where there are seats to sit on.It comes out of the wood by a little fishing hut onto a stony road that leads to Edenhall church.From here I go to the main road which brings me back to Langwathby bridge and the village.
